metadata.title: CVE-2024-36032 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:Bluetooth: qca: fix info leak when fetching fw build id Add the missingsanity checks and move the 255-byte build-id buffer off the stack to avoidleaking stack data through debugfs in case the build-info reply ismalformed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-36032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
